intro: Botrychium spathulatum, commonly known as the broad-leaf moonwort, is a fern-like plant belonging to the family Osmundaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, broad, ovate leaves that are often divided into a central stalk and lateral lobes. The plant produces sporangia on the undersides of its fronds, which are arranged in a unique, clustered pattern. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Botrychium spathulatum is a perennial plant that is often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere.
